Regardless of how tired he was, he needed to finish the project; as the deadline was fast approaching, it was important for him to secure funding, and he hoped that if he could demonstrate sufficient progress to the investors, they would provide the necessary financial support; otherwise, they might lose interest and withdraw their previous offer, leaving him without a source of income and forcing him to find alternative means to meet his financial obligations; but even if this unfortunate scenario unfolded, he vowed to complete the project as it was his duty and responsibility to deliver on the promise he had made to his team; because their hard work and trust in his leadership depended on his resolve and determination to see the venture through to success.

If he were taller, if she loved him more deeply, if the weather stayed fine, if his sister arrived earlier, if the clock hadn't struck twelve, and if he had more experience, they could have danced at the party.

If John hadn't spilled the paint, if the sun hadn't set, if the phone hadn't rung, if the cat hadn't scratched the furniture, if Susan hadn't forgotten her keys, if the traffic lights hadn't turned red, we would have arrived at the party on time.

If it rains, the flowers will wilt and close, their petals becoming slimy and translucent; the birds will seek shelter in their nests, the sunflower heads turning toward the ground; the bees will stay indoors, their wings unmoving; my daughter will wear her boots and raincoat instead of her sandals and sunsuit; we will all stay inside drinking cocoa by the fire.

If John would have eaten breakfast, and if the traffic light had been red instead of green, and if he hadn't had a flat tire, and if the weather had been fine, and if he hadn't missed the turn, he would have arrived at the office on time.

Though it might rain tonight, because we had planned a picnic in the park, and the food was already prepared, despite knowing that the grass could be wet, and the sandwiches might get soggy, unless we used an umbrella for ourselves, and we would probably also need to protect our blankets, yet deciding to proceed with the picnic rather than canceling it, because we wanted a fun day out with friends, ultimately resulted in a memorable experience for everyone involved.

Even if the weather were rainy, the game would still be ongoing, since the roof was closed and all necessary preparations had been made, yet some participants were hesitant, fearing slippery surfaces, and despite their apprehensions, others remained enthusiastic, insisting the game be played, while many spectators were eagerly anticipating the events, believing the game would be more exciting with rain.

If it rains tomorrow, my dog may want to stay indoors; if I go hiking, I should bring a map; while she sleeps peacefully, my cat sometimes grins in her dreams; before leaving the house, I check the newspaper; even if I study late, I must feed the fish; despite being lost in thought, I still remember to buy milk at the store.
If John would have come earlier, he could have attended the entire presentation; but because it began before he did, he missed the first 15 minutes.
